hints.content:
This circle is **not** split into equal sized pieces.

![A circle divided into 4 unequal parts. Two larger parts are equal in size. Two smaller parts are equal in size. One large part is shaded blue.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/8ef87a39da0a114e72e1b0d5d2a5f4697ee8d68e)

This circle is split into $3$ equal-sized pieces, or $\text{thirds}$, with $1$ piece shaded.  

![A circle divided into 3 equal parts. One part is shaded purple.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/4dc9445697b7d2dcf43b5ad2270d0048ff91a237)

The circle has one third of the shape shaded.

This circle is split into $4$ equal-sized pieces, or $\text{fourths}$, with $1$ piece shaded.  

![A circle divided into 4 equal parts. One part is shaded red.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/ce0441a6f599a9792587c3b9e1f46cd9a2cdaf67)

The circle has one fourth of the shape shaded.

This circle has one fourth of the shape shaded:

![A circle divided into 4 equal parts. One part is shaded red.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/ce0441a6f599a9792587c3b9e1f46cd9a2cdaf67)

question.content:
**Which circle shows one fourth of the shape shaded?**

choices.content: ![A circle divided into 4 equal parts. One part is shaded red.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/ce0441a6f599a9792587c3b9e1f46cd9a2cdaf67)

![A circle divided into 4 unequal parts. Two larger parts are equal in size. Two smaller parts are equal in size. One large part is shaded blue.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/8ef87a39da0a114e72e1b0d5d2a5f4697ee8d68e)
![A circle divided into 3 equal parts. One part is shaded purple.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/4dc9445697b7d2dcf43b5ad2270d0048ff91a237)
